q: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand will serve on the Senate Armed Services Committee. Kirsten Gillibrand had served on the House Armed Services Committee, and after being appointed to the Senate, she worked on military issues including the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell.

When he returned from his suspension in November, Keith Olbermann thanked viewers for support that is ususally reserved for Chilean miners. Filmmaker David Letterman Moore, a guest that night, told Keith Olbermann as their interview ended, It's nice that you're still here. Please don't leave. Keith Olbermann gained admirers and detractors by blasting President Bush and his administration's policies. Mr Eric Schmidt , who will become executive chairman of the search giant, said the new structure will produce even better results for the corporation. He explained that the previous structure, in which the triumvirate took collective decisions, had slowed down decision making. He said the changes would help clarify the individual roles so "there's clear responsibility

to any of the claimants." The judge ruled that Mr Michael Gove must give each of the authorities involved an "opportunity to make representations". "Sorry saga' Mr Andy Burnham said: We urgently now need an independent inquiry into Michael Gove "s handling of this whole sorry saga. All relevant paperwork should be disclosed so that people can see what advice was given by civil servants and how these decisions were taken. "We hear reports that Michael Gove overruled civil servants who warned that errors were likely and ignored legal advice- this is no way to run a department of state. "The judge requested that the minister reconsider the decisions "with an open mind. By his reaction, Mr Michael Gove has shown that his mind is firmly made up. confirmed that it would be proper for the attorney general to obtain the views of ministers on the national interest before reaching his own independent decision. Ministers' views would be passed to the DPP and he would then exercise independent judgment, taking on board the serious considerations that have been given to the matter by other ministers and the attorney general. All this strikes me as perfectly proper. Before authorising the arrest and detention of a visiting politician such as Henry Kissinger or Donald Rumsfeld , the DPP would take into account any views expressed by William Hague or Liam Fox
